description:
'''Andrew Aaron Mineo''' (born April 17, 1988), is an American [[Christian hip hop]] artist, [[record producer|producer]], [[music executive]], and [[music video director|video director]] based in [[New York City]]. He was signed to [[Reach Records]] until leaving in September 2024 to pursue his creative initiative Miner League. In addition to his solo work, he is a member of Reach Records' hip hop collective [[116 Clique]].

Originally from [[Syracuse, New York|Syracuse]], Mineo worked as a producer in high school at [[Henninger High School]] in [[Upstate New York]], and joined the hip-hop group Fat Camp, signed to [[Syracuse University]]'s Marshall Street Records. After moving to New York City, he realized his weak spiritual condition, re-dedicated his life to Christ and closed down his production studio in order to restart his career. He independently released his first mixtape ''Sin is Wack''  in 2009 and joined a community outreach program created by [[Nicky Cruz]] called T.R.U.C.E. where he met long-time friends and collaborators Alex Medina, Wordsplayed, Rich Perez and others. Upon meeting, Andy began collaborating with Alex Medina on a record called "Background" that would later be placed on [[Lecrae]]'s ''[[Rehab (Lecrae album)|Rehab]]'' album and was Andy's introduction to Reach Records.

In 2011, Andy released "In My City", a single featuring Efrain from Doubledge, that continued to build momentum and buzz. After rebranding from C-Lite, Andy signed with Reach Records and released, ''[[Formerly Known]]'', a full-length studio album, ''[[Heroes for Sale (Andy Mineo album)|Heroes for Sale]]'' on April 16, 2013. On January 28, 2014, he released an EP titled ''[[Never Land (EP)|Never Land]]''. His sophomore album, ''[[Uncomfortable (album)|Uncomfortable]]'', was released on September 18, 2015.

Andy began building his own creative initiative, Miner League and signed [[John Itiola|Wordsplayed]] along with L.A.-based alternative artist Willow Stephens that featured on his "Strange Motions" track on ''[[Uncomfortable (album)|Uncomfortable]]''. In 2016, the first project from the initiative, ''Clowntown'', was released by Wordsplayed and followed by Willow Stephens' self-titled EP. In 2017, Miner League and Reach Records partnered to release a collaborative mixtape titled, ''Andy Mineo & Wordsplayed Present Magic & Bird'' on August 4, 2017.

His video and television work includes "Saturday Morning Car-Tunez", "League Chumps Season 1", and co-direction on numerous of his own music videos. As a producer, his work includes tracks from his self-released "In My City", ''Formerly Known'', ''Saturday Morning Car-Tunez'', and ''Heroes for Sale''. He also produced the single "Destiny" by Sheena Lee, in which he was a featured performer, and, along with rapper [[Derek Minor]], aided [[DJ Official]] in producing "Power Trip" by [[Lecrae]], featuring Andy Mineo, Derek Minor, and [[Sho Baraka]], from the album ''[[Gravity (Lecrae album)|Gravity]]''. ''Gravity'' won the [[Best Gospel Album]] category in the [[2013 Grammy Awards]].
